Dear Ms. Santer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Courtney Atkins, at (517) 599-3667.

ALLEGATION:
Facility failed to notify the department of a change in training curriculum timely.
INVESTIGATION:
A review of Teaching Family Homes – Cedar Creek behavior management approval
was conducted on May 1, 2020. The approved letter on file was for Crisis Prevention
Institutes Non-Violent Crisis Intervention Model (CPI) and was dated May 3, 2018.
On May 1, 2020 I emailed Chief Administrator to verify this was the behavior model
they were continuing to utilize, and Chief Administrator said, “No. It is Handle with
Care.” I requested the Chief Administrator to provide me with a copy of the approval
letter from the department for Handle with Care. Chief Administrator said she never
received an approval letter for Handle with Care.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on May 1, 2020. Chief
Administrator said in April of 2018 she was in contact with the assigned licensing
consultant for another licensed facility to provide the information requested for CPI
and received a letter from the department for approval for all five licenses for that
training curriculum. When the facility was changing from CPI to Handle with Care
Chief Administrator said she sent the request letter to the same consultant instead of
2

Cedar Creek’s assigned consultant. Chief Administrator said she was “newer” to her
role and so was still learning all the requirements needed from the department. Chief
Administrator said she did not seek any additional approval or response from the
assigned consultant for Cedar Creek prior to changing the training curriculum for the
facility.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(5) An employee shall not participate in restraining a
resident or placing a resident in seclusion prior to receiving
training on those topics. The training model shall be
approved, in writing, by the department.
ANALYSIS: Teaching Family Homes – Cedar Creek administration failed to
obtain approval in writing for the training curriculum. The facility
changed the curriculum and did not make the request to the
assigned consultant, therefore did not have approval in writing
from November 2, 2018 until May 7, 2020.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.
